meanings.definition: The act of delegating tasks or responsibilities to others.
meanings.sent1: She showed great delegacies by assigning different jobs to her team members.
meanings.sent2: The manager's delegacies made the project run smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The delegacies of choosing who gets to be the line leader in class were highly contested.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, each piece has its own delegacies on the board.
meanings.sent5: The delegacies of the queen bee in the hive ensure the colony's survival.

meanings.definition: An individual or group of individuals who have been delegated authority or responsibilities.
meanings.sent1: The delegacies in the company were trusted to make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The delegacies met to discuss the upcoming changes in the organization.
meanings.sent3: The delegacies at the meeting had a heated debate over the budget allocation.
meanings.sent4: As the delegacies of the team, they had to ensure everyone was on the same page.
meanings.sent5: The delegacies of the student council were responsible for planning the school event.

meanings.definition: The authority or power given to someone to act on behalf of another.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer had the delegacies to represent the client in court.
meanings.sent2: The delegacies granted to the ambassador allowed for diplomatic negotiations.
meanings.sent3: The delegacies given to the babysitter included making sure the children were in bed on time.
meanings.sent4: With great delegacies comes great responsibility to make decisions for others.
meanings.sent5: The delegacies bestowed upon the knight by the king were a mark of trust and honor.
